code:
Port scanning is a technique used to identify the available ports on a network that are in use or could be vulnerable for injection attacks. In this scenario, you will perform a port scan on a server or device to identify the available ports for specific applications or protocols. Here is an example of a Scan Code to use in this scenario:
```
/system/bin/apksample.sh -d 31457
```
where:
- This is a unique identifier for your Scan Code script. You can customize this number to any value you prefer.
- `-d` is a flag for "debug", which shows more details about the available ports and their status.
